State.Description: Top state for the Spin Chuck State machine
Pseudo state of the Spin Chuck prior to creation
Spin Chuck is initialized and ready for use

StateMachine.Description: State machine for the spinning state of the Spin Chuck

State.Description: Top state for the Spin State machine
Pseudo state of the spin prior to creation
Spin chuck is at rest
Spin chuck is spinning
Spin chuck is accelerating (or decelerating)
Spin chuck is at speed

Transition.Description: Spin chuck initialized to at-rest
Spin chuck accelerating or decelerating to set point
Spin chuck reached set-point speed
Spin chuck stopped spinning
Spin chuck starting accelerating or decelerating from previous set-point to next set-point

Event.Description: Spin chuck initialized
Spin chuck accelerating or decelerating to set point
Spin chuck reached set-point speed
Spin chuck stopped spinning
Spin chuck starting accelerating or decelerating from previous set-point to next set-point

StateMachine.Description: State machine for the position state of the Spin Chuck

State.Description: Top state for the Position State machine
Pseudo state of the position prior to creation
Spin chuck is at rest
Spin chuck is in transit

Transition.Description: Spin chuck initialize to at-rest
Spin chuck started moving up or down
Spin chuck stopped moving

Event.Description: Spin chuck initialize
Spin chuck started moving up or down
Spin chuck stopped moving

Transition.Description: Spin Chuck initialized
Spin Chuck powered down

State.Description: Top state for the Photo resist pump state machine
Pseudo state of the pump prior to creation
Pump is Idle (off)
Pump is activated (on)

Transition.Description: Pump initialized to idle
Pump started pumping
Pump stopped pumping

Event.Description: Pump initialized to idle
Pump started pumping
Pump stopped pumping

State.Description: Top state in the MFC state machine
Pseudo state of the MFC prior to creation
MFC is on
MFC is off

Transition.Description: MFC Initialized to off
MFC Turned On
MFC Turned Off

Event.Description: MFC Initialized to off
MFC Turned On
MFC Turned Off

State.Description: Top state of the Transfer Robot state machine
Pseudo state of the Transfer Robot prior to creation
Transfer robot is at rest
Transfer robot is in transit

Transition.Description: Transfer robot initialized to at-rest
Transfer robot starting moving
Transfer robot stopped moving

Event.Description: Transfer robot initialized
Transfer robot starting moving
Transfer robot stopped moving

State.Description: Top state of the Transfer Arm state machine
Pseudo state of the Transfer Arm prior to creation
Transfer arm is at rest
Transfer arm is in transit

Transition.Description: Transfer arm initialized to at-rest
Transfer arm starting moving
Transfer arm stopped moving

Event.Description: Transfer arm initialized to at-rest
Transfer arm starting moving
Transfer arm stopped moving

State.Description: Top state of the Valve state machine
Pseudo state of the Valve prior to creation
Valve is open
Valve is closed

Transition.Description: Valve initialized to closed
Valve opened allowing substance to flow
Valve closed turning off supply of substance

Event.Description: Valve initialized to closed
Valve opened allowing substance to flow
Valve closed turning off supply of substance

State.Description: Top state of the Hood state machine
Pseudo state of the Hood prior to creation
Hood is open
Hood is closed

Transition.Description: Hood initialized to the Open state
Hood initialized to the Closed state
Hood opened
Hood closed

Event.Description: Hood initialized to the Open state
Hood initialized to the Closed state
Hood opened
Hood closed

State.Description: Top state of the Pin Position state machine
Pseudo state of the Pin Position prior to creation
Pins are down
Pins are up

Transition.Description: Pin position initialized to the down position
Pin position initialized to the up position
Pins raised to the up position
Pins lowered to the down position

Event.Description: Pin position initialized to the down position
Pin position initialized to the up position
Pins raised to the up position
Pins lowered to the down position

State.Description: Top state of the Temperature Condition state machine
Pseudo state of the Temperature Condition prior to creation
Temperature in adjusting
Temperature is stable

Transition.Description: Temperature condition initialized to the stable state
Temperature has started changing
Temperature has reach a stable value

Event.Description: Temperature condition initialized to the stable state
Temperature has started changing
Temperature has reach a stable value

State.Description: Top state for dispense arm state machine
Pseudo state of the Dispense Arm prior to creation
Dispense arm is in transit
Dispense arm is at rest

Transition.Description: Dispense Arm initialized to at-rest
Dispense Arm stopped moving
Dispense Arm started moving

Event.Description: Dispense Arm initialized to at-rest
Dispense Arm stopped moving
Dispense Arm started moving

State.Description: Top state for the vacuum pump state machine
Pseudo state of the pump prior to creation
Pump is on (running)
Pump is off (stopped)

Transition.Description: Pump initialized to off
Pump started pumping
Pump stopped pumping

Event.Description: Pump initialized to idle
Pump started pumping
Pump stopped pumping

State.Description: Processing State Model
Pseudo state of the processing model outside creation
Equipment systems initialization
Equipment is awaiting instructions
Contains all sub-states where the context of process program execution exists
Contains all sub-states that refer to the active preparation and execution of a process program
All external conditions necessary for process execution are satisfied
Equipment is ready for process execution and awaiting a Start from the operator or the host
Equipment is executing a process program automatically and can continue to do so without external intervention
Processing is suspended and the equipment is awaiting a command

Transition.Description: Processing state system created
Equipment initialization complete
Commit has been made to setup
All setup activity has completed and the equipment is ready to receive a Start command
Equipment has received a Start command from the host or operator console
The process task has been completed
Equipment has received a Stop command from host or operator console
Equipment has received an Abort command from host or operator console
Equipment decided to pause due to a condition such as an alarm
Equipment has received a Pause command from host or operator console
Equipment has received a Resume command from host or operator console
Equipment has received a Resume command from host or operator console
Equipment has received a Resume command from host or operator console

Event.Description: Equipment initialization complete
Commit has been made to setup
All setup activity has completed and the equipment is ready to receive a Start command
Equipment has received a Start command from the host or operator console
The process task has been completed
Equipment has received a Stop command from host or operator console
Equipment has received a Stop command from host or operator console
Equipment decided to pause due to a condition such as an alarm
Equipment has received a Pause command from host or operator console
Equipment has received a Resume command from host or operator console. Processing had been paused from Setup state.
Equipment has received a Resume command from host or operator console. Processing had been paused from Ready state.
Equipment has received a Resume command from host or operator console. Processing had been paused from Executing state.

State.Description: Control State Model
Pseudo initial state of the control system just prior to creation
Operation of the equipment is performed by the operator at the operator console, messaging for any automation purpose is severely limited
System maintains the OffLine state and requires operator instructions to attempt to go OnLine
Equipment attempting to change state to OnLine
Equipment is intent on being Online, however, the Host has not agreed
Automation messages may be exchanged
Operation of the equipment is implemented by direct action of an operator
Operation of the equipment is implemented by host automation

Transition.Description: System initialized and default startup control state set to OffLine
System initialized and default startup control state set to Online
Default Offline state set to EquipmentOffline
Default Offline state set to AttemptOnLine
Default Offline state set to HostOffLine
Operator sets control to OnLine, S1F1 sent to host
Communication failure occurred, a reply timeout occurred, or an S1F0 was received; and the AttemptOnLine fail option is set to EquipmentOffline
Communication failure occurred, a reply timeout occurred, or an S1F0 was received; and the AttemptOnLine fail option is set to HostOffline
Equipment received S1F2 message from the host
Operator sets control to OffLine
Default OnLine state is Local
Default OnLine state is Remote
Operator sets control state to Remote
Equipment accepts Offline message from host (S1F15)
Equipment accepts Offline message from host (S1F15)
Equipment accepts Online message from host (S1F17)
Operator sets control to Offline

Event.Description: Equipment Control State Offline
Equipment Control State Local
Equipment Control State Remote

State.Description: Process Job State Model
Pseudo state of the ProcessJob prior to creation or after destruction
The ProcessJob has been accepted by the processing resource through a PR Job Create/Acknowledge transaction and is awaiting execution
Parent state of all sub-states where the context of an active process job execution exists
Parent state of those sub-states that refer to the preparation and execution of a ProcessJob
The processing resource performs pre-conditioning, waits material arrival, and prepares for material processing
Setup is complete and a PR Job Start Process has not yet been received by the processing resource
The processing resource is doing the actual material processing using the equipment recipe(s) specified by the PR Job
The processing resource is performing a stop procedure to terminate processing in an orderly manner
The process resource is performing an abort or an optional recovery procedure
The processing resource is suspending or has suspended activity
The processing resource continues to the first safe, continuable place and then ceases activity
All processing resource activity has ceased
Parent state of those states that refer to the final (completion) of the ProcessJob
The processing resource has completed processing all material specified by the PR Job
Final state for those jobs that have been in the Aborting State
Final state for those jobs that have been in the Stopping State

Transition.Description: The processing resource accepts a ProcessJob create request. The job is added to the job queue/pool
The processing resource has been allocated to the ProcessJob. The job is removed from the job queue/pool and preconditioning begins
Job material is present and processing resource is ready to start the process job and PRProcessStart attribute is not set (false)
Material is present and ready for processing, and PRProcessStart attribute is set (true)
Job start directive
Material processing complete. Any post conditioning begins

Job material departs from the equipment or the ProcessJjob becomes extinct because the ProcessJob is replaced by another ProcessJob that specifies the same material when no control job is used. ProcessJob is deleted
The processing resource initiated a process pause action. Material processing continues until the first convenient pause point is reached
The processing resource paused the job
The processing resource resumed the job and the job was being setup prior to the pause
The processing resource resumed the job and the job was waiting for a start prior to the pause
The processing resource resumed the job and the job was processing prior to the pause
The processing resource initiated a process stop action. Material processing continues until the first convenient stop point is reached
The processing resource initiated a process stop action. Material processing continues until the first convenient stop point is reached
The processing resource initiated a process abort action. The processing activity terminates immediately
The processing resource initiated a process abort action. The processing activity terminates immediately
TThe processing resource initiated a process abort action. The processing activity terminates immediately
The abort procedure is completed
The stop procedure is completed
Cancel, Abort, or Stop command received. ProcessJob is removed from the queue/pool

Event.Description: The processing resource accepts a ProcessJob create request
The processing resource has been allocated to the ProcessJob
Job material is present and processing resource is ready to start the ProcessJob and PRProcessStart attribute is not set
Material is present and ready for processing. PRProcessStart attribute is set
Job start directive
Material processing complete
Job material departs from the equipment or the ProcessJob becomes extinct because the ProcessJob is replaced by another ProcessJob that specifies the same material when no control job is used
The processing resource initiated a process pause action
The processing resource paused the job
The processing resource resumed the job and the job was being setup prior to the pause
The processing resource resumed the job and the job was waiting for a start prior to the pause
The processing resource resumed the job and the job was processing prior to the pause
The processing resource initiated a process stop action
The processing resource initiated a process stop action
The processing resource initiated a process abort action
The processing resource initiated a process abort action
The processing resource initiated a process abort action
The abort procedure is completed
The stop procedure is completed
Cancel, Abort, or Stop command received

State.Description: Carrier State Model
Pseudo state of the carrier prior to creation or after destruction
Carrier object exists
Carrier ID Status State Model
Pseudo state of the carrier prior to creation or after destruction
Carrier ID has not been read by the equipment
Carrier ID has been ready by the equipment successfully or unsuccessfully and has not yet been verified by the host

Carrier ID has been accepted, either by successful verification by the equipment or the host, or by bypassing ID read because a carrier ID reader is not available and the BypassReadID variable is set to true
Carrier ID has failed verification by the host following the CancelCarrier service

Transition.Description: Bind or Carrier Notification service received
A carrier ID not currently existing at the equipment is successfully read or a carrier ID read is successful but an equipment based verification failed
ProceedWithCarrier service is received after an ID read fail or unknown carrier. Carrier is created from the ProceedWithCarrier
CancelCarrier service is received after an ID read fail or unknown carrier. Carrier is created from the CancelCarrier

Carrier ID is read successfully and the equipment has verified the carrier ID successfully; or carrier was instantiated via a CarrierNotification service and upon carrier placement the equipment sent a Carrier ID Read Fail Event or UnknownCarrierID, and the host issued a ProceedWithCarrier
Carrier ID was read unsuccessfully
A ProceedWithCarrier service is received
CancelCarrier service is received
BypassReadID variable is set to False, and a carrier is received when the carrier ID reader is not in service or not installed
BypassReadID variable is set to True, and a carrier is received when the carrier ID reader is not in service or not installed

Event.Description: Bind or Carrier Notification service received
A carrier ID not currently existing at the equipment is successfully read or a carrier ID read is successful but an equipment based verification failed
ProceedWithCarrier service is received after an ID read fail or unknown carrier. Carrier is created from the ProceedWithCarrier
CancelCarrier service is received after an ID read fail or unknown carrier. Carrier is created from the CancelCarrier

Carrier ID is read successfully and the equipment has verified the carrier ID successfully; or carrier was instantiated via a CarrierNotification service and upon carrier placement the equipment sent a Carrier ID Read Fail Event or UnknownCarrierID, and the host issued a ProceedWithCarrier
Carrier ID was read unsuccessfully
A ProceedWithCarrier service is received
CancelCarrier service is received
BypassReadID variable is set to False, and a carrier is received when the carrier ID reader is not in service or not installed
BypassReadID variable is set to True, and a carrier is received when the carrier ID reader is not in service or not installed

StateMachine.Description: Carrier Slot Map Status State Model

State.Description: Carrier Slot Map Status State Model
Pseudo state of the carrier prior to creation or after destruction
Carrier has been loaded on the equipment but the slot map has not been read successfully by the equipment
Equipment is waiting for input from the host
Slot map has been verified
Slot map has been read by the equipment and has failed verification by the host

Transition.Description: Carrier is instantiated
Slot map is read and verified by the equipment

Slot map read successfully and the equipment is waiting for host verification, or slot map is read successfully but equipment based verification has failed, slot map cannot be read, or slot map read has indicated an abnormal substrate position. Slot Map attribute updated with read slot map
ProceedWithCarrier service is received
CancelCarrier service is received. Prepare carrier for unload

Event.Description: Carrier is instantiated
Slot map is read and verified by the equipment

Slot map read successfully and the equipment is waiting for host verification, or slot map is read successfully but equipment based verification has failed, slot map cannot be read, or slot map read has indicated an abnormal substrate position. Slot Map attribute updated with read slot map
ProceedWithCarrier service is received
CancelCarrier service is received. Prepare carrier for unload

State.Description: Carrier Accessing Status State Model
Pseudo state of the carrier prior to creation or after destruction
Access by the equipment to the carrier has not been started
Access by the equipment to the carrier has been started but has not finished
Access by the equipment to the carrier has been finished
Access by the equipment has been stopped abnormally

Transition.Description: Carrier is instantiated
Equipment starts accessing the carrier
Equipment finishes accessing the carrier normally
Equipment finishes accessing the carrier abnormally

Event.Description: Carrier is instantiated
Equipment starts accessing the carrier
Equipment finishes accessing the carrier normally
Equipment finishes accessing the carrier abnormally

Transition.Description: Carrier is instantiated

Carrier is unloaded from the equipment, CancelBind or CancelCarrierNotification service is received pror to the carrier load, or an equipment based verification fails and the equipment performs a self-initiated CancelBind service. The carrier object is destroyed

Event.Description: Carrier is instantiated

Carrier is unloaded from the equipment, CancelBind or CancelCarrierNotification service is received pror to the carrier load, or an equipment based verification fails and the equipment performs a self-initiated CancelBind service. The carrier object is destroyed

State.Description: Load Port Transfer State Model
Pseudo state of the load port prior to creation or after destruction
Transfer to/from this load port is disabled
Transfer to/from this load port is enabled
Load port is available for carrier transfer
Load port is available to be loaded with an external carrier, or with a carrier that is currently located inside the equipment
Load port is available for unloading of a carrier from the Load Port to material handling equipment
Load port related activity being performed, transfer is not available to/from this load port at this time

Transition.Description: System reset, prior state was out of service
System reset, prior state was in service
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceState service for this load port with a value of InService. The load port is usable for transfers
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceState service for this load port with a value of OutOfService. The load port is unusable for transfers
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceStatus for this load port with a value of InService or system was reset, and the load port is currently available for transfers
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceStatus for this load port with a value of InService or system was reset, and the load port is not currently available for carrier transfer
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceStatus service for this load port with a value of InService or system was reset or a transfer failed, and no carrier is present on the Load Port
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceStatus service for this load port with a value of InService or system was reset or a transfer failed, and a carrier is present on the Load Port

Equipment recognizes the logical indication of the start of a manual load transfer, an automated PIO load transfer is beginning and the PIO Ready signal is active, or a CarrierOut service is started for this load port

Equipment recognizes the logical indication of the start of a manual unload transfer, an automated PIO unload transfer is beginning and the PIO READY signal is active, a CarrierIn service is started for this load port, or a CarrierReCreate service has been issued by the host or operator

Manual carrier unload transfer has completed and the Load Port is now empty and ready for load transfer, an automated PIO unload transfer ends with the PIO COMPT signal, or the carrier has finished its move from the load port into the internal buffer and no CarrierOut services are queued for this load port

Processing for substrates contained with the carrier has complete or a CancelCarrier/CancelCarrierAtPort service has been issued, and the carrier has returned to the load/unload position on the load port while in Manual; Processing for the substrates belonging to the carrier has completed, or a CancelCarrier/CancelCarrierAtPort service has been received, and the carrier has returned to the load/unload position while in Automatic
Transfer was unsuccessful and the carrier has not loaded or unloaded

Event.Description: System reset, prior state was out of service
System reset, prior state was in service
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceState service for this load port with a value of InService
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceState service for this load port with a value of OutOfService
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceStatus for this load port or system was reset
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceStatus for this load port with a value of InService or system was reset, and the load port is not currently available for carrier transfer
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceStatus service for this load port with a value of InService or system was reset or a transfer failed, and no carrier is present on the Load Port
Host or operator has invoked the ChangeServiceStatus service for this load port with a value of InService or system was reset or a transfer failed, and a carrier is present on the Load Port

Equipment recognizes the logical indication of the start of a manual load transfer, an automated PIO load transfer is beginning and the PIO Ready signal is active, or a CarrierOut service is started for this load port

Equipment recognizes the logical indication of the start of a manual unload transfer, an automated PIO unload transfer is beginning and the PIO Ready signal is active, a CarrierIn service is started for this load port, or a CarrierReCreate service has been issued by the host or operator

Manual carrier unload transfer has completed and the Load Port is now empty and ready for load transfer, an automated PIO unload transfer ends with the PIO Compt signal, or the carrier has finished its move from the load port into the internal buffer and no CarrierOut services are queued for this load port

Processing for substrates contained within the carrier has completed, or a CancelCarrier/CancelCarrierAtPort service has been issued, and the carrier has returned to the load/unload position on the load port while in Manual; Processing for the substrates belonging to the carrier has completed, or a CancelCarrier/CancelCarrierAtPort service has been received, and the carrier has returned to the load/unload position while in Automatic
Transfer was unsuccessful and the carrier has not loaded or unloaded

State.Description: Load Port Reservation State Model
Pseudo initial state of the load port reservation system just prior to creation
No reservation exists for the load port
A reservation for future activity at the load port exists

Transition.Description: System initialized
Host or operator sends a ReserveAtPort or Bind to the equipment, or a CarrierOut occurs on the equipment
Host or operator sends a CancelBind or a CancelReservationAtPort, or a carrier arrives at the reserved port

Event.Description: System initialized
Host or operator sends a ReserveAtPort or Bind to the equipment, or a CarrierOut occurs on the equipment
Host or operator sends a CancelBind or a CancelReservationAtPort, or a carrier arrives at the reserved port

StateMachine.Description: Load Port / Carrier Association State Model

State.Description: Load Port / Carrier Association State Model
Pseudo initial state of the association system just prior to creation
No carrier association present for the Load Port
Carrier has been associated with the Load Port

Transition.Description: System initialized

ost sends a Bind when the port is unoccupied, carrier created because the host sends either a ProceedWithCarrier or CancelCarrier, a Carrier ID that does not currently exist at the equipment is successfully read, or a known carrier to the equipment is being moved onto the load port from an internal location
Host sends a CancelBind to the equipment before the carrier arrives or before a transfer sequence has started, or carrier is removed from the load port externally or to an internal buffer position

Equipment based verification fails and the carrier assumes the ID value from the carrier that is on the load port, or a carrier is unloaded and a queued CarrierOut service starts. The existing carrierID that was associated by a Bind service is unassociated and the new carrierID is now associated to the Load Port

Event.Description: System initialized

Host sends a Bind when the port is unoccupied, carrier created because the host sends either a ProceedWithCarrier or CancelCarrier, Carrier ID not currently existing at the equipment successfully read, or a known carrier to the equipment is being moved onto the load port from an internal location
Host sends a CancelBind to the equipment before the carrier arrives or before a transfer sequence has started, or carrier is removed from the load port externally or to an internal buffer position

Equipment based verification fails and the carrier assumes the ID value from the carrier that is on the load port, or a carrier is unloaded and a queued CarrierOut service starts. The existing carrierID that was associated by a Bind service is unassociated and the new carrierID is now associated to the Load Port

State.Description: Access mode State Model
Pseudo initial state of the access mode system just prior to creation
Only manual (non-AMHS) carrier transfers are allowed
Only automated (AMHS) carrier transfers are allowed

Transition.Description: System initialized and state at shutdown was Manual
System initialized and state at shutdown was Auto
Host or operator has executed a Change Access service with the value of Auto
Host or operator has executed a Change Access service with the value of Manual

Event.Description: System initialized
System initialized
Host or operator has executed a Change Access service with the value of Auto
Host or operator has executed a Change Access service with the value of Manual

State.Description: Substrate Object State Model
Pseudo state of the substrate object prior to creation or after destruction
Substrate object exists
Substrate Transport State Model
Pseudo state of the substrate transport prior to creation or after destruction
Substrate is at the original location it was received
Substrate has been taken from the original substrate location, and is traveling on intermediate equipment substrate locations
Substrate has been placed at its designated destination substrate location

Transition.Description: Substrate object is registered
Substrate is taken from the source substrate location and placed into the equipment
Substrate has moved to the source substrate location
Substrate has moved out from current equipment substrate location towards a new equipment substrate location
Substrate is moved to the destination substrate location
Substrate is taken from the destination substrate location and placed into the equipment
User informs or the equipment detects that the substrate is At Source

Event.Description: Substrate object is registered
Substrate is taken from the source substrate location and placed into the equipment
Substrate has moved to the source substrate location
Substrate has moved out from current equipment substrate location towards a new equipment substrate location
Substrate is moved to the destination substrate location
Substrate is taken from the destination substrate location and placed into the equipment
User informs or the equipment detects that the substrate is At Source

State.Description: Substrate Processing State Model
Pseudo state of the substrate processing prior to creation or after destruction
Processing requirements exist that have not yet been fulfilled
Substrate is being processed
Substrate has completed all processing associated with a recipe specification
All Substrate processing has successfully completed
Substrate has been processed completely, however, the result of processing may have a problem
The process has been stopped during processing
The process has been aborted during processing
Substrate has been broken and/or removed from the equipment by an external entity and it no longer exists at the equipment
As directed by an operator or host, the substrate was not processed

Transition.Description: Substrate object is created
Substrate starts actual processing
Processing completes normally
Process completes, but a problem may exist
Processing was stopped
Processing was aborted
Substrate was lost during processing
Processing was skipped
The process associated with the processing instructions was completed and the substrate is to be processed again
Substrate has been removed from the equipment by an external agent or is physically missing
Substrate has been skipped and not processed

Event.Description: Substrate object is created
Substrate starts actual processing
Processing completes normally
Process completes, but a problem may exist
Processing was stopped
Processing was aborted
Substrate was lost during processing
Processing was skipped
The process associated with the processing instructions was completed and the substrate is to be processed again
Substrate has been removed from the equipment by an external agent or is physically missing
Substrate has been skipped and not processed

State.Description: Substrate Reading Status State Model
Pseudo state of the substrate reading status prior to creation or after destruction
The substrate identifier has not been confirmed
Substrate ID could not be identified by the reader, was discovered to be at a wrong source location, or no matching ID in the source set
Substrate ID has been confirmed by the equipment or the host after it was read
Host decides to cancel the substrate

Transition.Description: Substrate object is created
Substrate was successfully read and SubstID provided in the ContentMap matched the AcquiredID read by the equipment
Substrate ID reading has failed after all retries
Substrate ID was successfully read but the acquired ID is different from the one the equipment used to instantiate the substrate object
Equipment has received a ProceedWithSubstrate
Equipment has received a CancelSubstrate

Event.Description: Substrate object is created
Substrate was successfully read and SubstID provided in the ContentMap matched the AcquiredID read by the equipment
Substrate ID reading has failed after all retries
Substrate ID was successfully read but the acquired ID is different from the one the equipment used to instantiate the substrate object
Equipment has received a ProceedWithSubstrate
Equipment has received a CancelSubstrate

Transition.Description: Substrate object created
Substrate removed from the equipment by a normal transfer sequence
Equipment detects or is informed by the user that a substrate has been removed

Event.Description: Substrate object created
Substrate removed from the equipment by a normal transfer sequence
Equipment detects or is informed by the user that a substrate has been removed

State.Description: Substrate Location State Model
Pseudo initial state of the substrate location just prior to creation
The state in which the substrate location does not hold or have a substrate
The state in which the substrate location holds a substrate

Transition.Description: Substrate location is initialized without a substrate in the location
Substrate location is initialized with a substrate in the location
Substrate moves into the substrate location. A record is created in the SubstHistory for the Substrate placed in the location.
Substrate moves off the location. TimeOut in SubstHistory is updated

Event.Description: Substrate location is initialized without a substrate in the location
Substrate location is initialized with a substrate in the location
Substrate moves into the substrate location
Substrate moves off the location

State.Description: ControlJob State Model
Pseudo state of the ControlJob prior to creation or after destruction
ControlJob is queued
ControlJob is active on the equipment
ControlJob does not initiate ProcessJobs specific in it, the processing resource is reserved to the ControlJob
ControlJob is waiting to receive a Start command manually or remotely from the host
Each ProcessJob in the ProcessingCtrlSpec is initiated in order, based on the value of the ControlJob's ProcessOrderMgmt attribute as resources become available and materials arrive
ControlJob shall not commence the initiation of any more ProcessJobs
All ProcessJobs have been completed, stopped, or aborted

Transition.Description: Receive Create command from host or operator through operator console. ControlJob is created and placed at the end of the queue
Receive Cancel, Abort, or Stop command from host or operator through operator console. ControlJob is removed from the queue and deleted
Processing resource has capacity to begin work on the next ControlJob. Job at the head of the queue is dequeued and selected
Receive De-select command from host or operator through operator console and materials for the ControlJob have not arrived yet

Material for the first ProcessJob arrives or in the case where the first ProcessJob does not require material, this transition shall be taken as soon as the processing resource for that ProcessJob becomes available, and StartMethod is set for Auto

Material for the first ProcessJob arrives or in the case where the first ProcessJob does not require material, this transition shall be taken as soon as the processing resource for that ProcessJob becomes available, and StartMethod is set for user start
User Start command received
Received Pause command from host or operator, or a ControlJob PauseEvent has occurred
Received Resume command from host or operator
All the ProcessJobs specified for the ControlJob have completed

Equipment received a CJStop command from the host or operator or generated a CJStop internally, and all ProcessJobs under the ControlJob that were Active when the CJStop command was received have entered the PostActive state

Equipment received a CJAbort command from the host or operator or generated a CJAbort internally, and all ProcessJobs under the ControlJob that were Active when the CJAbort command was received have entered the PostActive state
ControlJob is deleted

Event.Description: Receive Create command from host or operator through operator console
Receive Cancel, Abort, or Stop command from host or operator through operator console
Processing resource has capacity to begin work on the next ControlJob
Receive De-select command from host or operator through operator console and materials for the ControlJob have not arrived yet

Material for the first ProcessJob arrives or in the case where the first ProcessJob does not require material, this transition shall be taken as soon as the processing resource for that ProcessJob becomes available, and StartMethod is set for Auto

Material for the first ProcessJob arrives or in the case where the first ProcessJob does not require material, this transition shall be taken as soon as the processing resource for that ProcessJob becomes available, and StartMethod is set for user start
User Start command received
Received Pause command from host or operator through operator console or a ControlJob PauseEvent has occurred
Received Resume command from host or operator through operator console
All the ProcessJobs specified for the ControlJob have completed

Equipment received a CJStop command from the host or operator or generated a CJStop internally, and all ProcessJobs under the ControlJob that were Active when the CJStop command was received have entered the PostActive state

Equipment received a CJAbort command from the host or operator or generated a CJAbort internally, and all ProcessJobs under the ControlJob that were Active when the CJAbort command was received have entered the PostActive state
ControlJob is deleted

StateMachine.Description: Equipment Performance State Model for Modules

State.Description: Equipment Performance State Model
Pseudo initial state of the EPT Tracker just prior to creation
No material is present, the module is not executing a task, and no fault condition exists in the module that prevents it from starting a new task
The module is executing a task and no fault condition exists in the module that prevents the execution of a task

A fault condition exists that prevents the EPT module from completing its task, a fault condition exists that prevents the EPT module from starting a new task, the EPT module is pausing (or aborting) resulting from a pause (or abort) directive, the EPT module has paused its task and is awaiting a resume, or the EPT module fails to initialize upon start-up

Transition.Description: EPT Module initialization complete, a fault exists, or the EPT module cannot be initialized
EPT Module initialization complete, a fault exists, or the EPT module cannot be initialized
EPT Module initialization complete, no fault exists, and material is present
EPT Module starts execution of a new task
EPT Module completes execution of a task and material is removed from the EPT Module
EPT Module starts execution of a new task upon the normal completion of the previous task. EPTStateTime and PreviousEPTStateTime do not change

A pause command is received that pauses the EPT module, an abort command is received that aborts the EPT module, or a fault condition occurs that prevents the EPT module from executing its task. TaskName and TaskType do not change
All fault conditions that prevented task execution are cleared and the EPT Module resumes execution of its tasks or starts execution of a new task
All fault conditions that prevented task execution are cleared, all material is removed from the EPT module, and EPT Module can begin a new task
Material arrives at the EPT Module and the EPT Module cannot begin executing a task on the material, or a fault condition occurs which prevents the EPTModule from starting a new task
Fault conditions occur that prevent the EPT Module from resuming a blocked task, or starting a new task. EPTStateTime and PreviousEPTStateTime do not change

Event.Description: Triggered by a EPT State change at the EPT Module level

StateMachine.Description: Equipment Performance State Model for Equipment

State.Description: Equipment Performance State Model
Pseudo initial state of the EPT Tracker just prior to creation
No blocked EPT modules prevent an EPT module from starting a new task and no EPT module is in the Busy state with a task type of 1-5
At least one EPT Module is Busy with a task type of 1-5
No EPT module is Busy with a task type of 1-5, and at least one Blocked EPT module prevents any EPT module from starting a new task

Transition.Description: Equipment initialization completes, No blocked EPT modules prevent an EPT module from starting a new task and no EPT module is in the Busy state with a task type of 1-5
Equipment initialization completes, At least one EPT Module is Busy with a task type of 1-5
Equipment initialization completes, No EPT module is Busy with a task type of 1-5, and at least one Blocked EPT module prevents any EPT module from starting a new task
At least one EPT module transitions to the Busy state with task type 1-5
All EPT modules that were Busy with a task type of 1-5 transition to either Idle or to Busy with a task type other than 1-5
Any EPT module transition to Busy state with task type 1-5

At least one EPT module transitions to a Blocked state and prevents another EPT module from starting a new task or completing an existing task, and there are no other EPT modules Busy with task type 1-5; or Any EPT module that was Busy with task type 1-5 transitions to either Idle or Busy with task type other than 1-5, and there is at least one Ept module in Blocked state that is preventing another EPT module from starting a new task or completing an existing task
At least one EPT module transitions to Busy with task type 1-5
All Blocked EPT modules that prevented another EPT module from starting a new task or completing a current task no longer prevent the EPT module from doing so
Any EPT module transitions to Blocked that prevents or continues to prevent EPT module from starting a new task

Any EPT module transitions to Blocked that prevents or continues to prevent another EPT module from starting a new task or completing a current task. EPTStateTime and PreviousEPTStateTime do not change

Event.Description: Triggered by a EPT State chghange at the EPT Module level

State.Description: Module Process State Model
Pseudo initial state of the module just prior to creation
The process module has no process execution activity in progress
Process execution for this process module is in progress
Process component is executing on the process module but not within a step in the recipe
A recipe step is executing on the process module within a step in a recipe

Transition.Description: Equipment initialization
Recipe executing affecting this process module has started
Recipe execution affecting this process module has completed normally
Recipe execution has failed to complete normally
StepStarted - Step execution affecting the process module has started
StepCompleted - Step execution has completed normally
StepFailed - Step execution has failed to complete normally

Event.Description: Equipment initialization
Process execution affecting this process module has started. This corresponds to the E157 ExecutionStarted event
Process execution affecting this process module has completed normally. This corresponds to the E157 ExecutionCompleted event
Process execution has failed to complete normally. This corresponds to the E157 ExecutionFailed event
Step execution affecting the process module has started. This corresponds to the E157 StepStarted event
Step execution has completed normally. This corresponds to the E157 StepCompleted event
Step execution has failed to complete normally. This corresponds to the E157 StepFailed event
